translations.description:
تقریبا تمامی نرم افزار ها نیازمند بک اند در وب یا سیستم سرویس (برای اپ دسکتاپ یا گوشی) هستند. من توانایی طراحی بک اند با استفاده از زبان سی و Golang را دارم و کل پروژه برای شما به صورت اختصاصی بدون وابستگی به سرویس های خارجی یا ثالث انجام میشود.
پروژه های بک اند طراحی شده توسط من با دیتابیس های مای اس کیو ال و SQLite کار میکنند و کاملا به صورت Type-Safe طراحی میشوند. این امر باعث این موضوع میشود که نرم افزار شما هیچ گاه نیاز به بازنویسی نخواهد داشت.
در چنین پروژه هایی امکانات زیادی نظیر مدیریت کاربران، دسترسی ها، دعوت نامه ها و ... بصورت رایگان به شما ارایه میشود که شامل بیش از ۱۰ سال تجربه در طراحی سیستم های بزرگ است.
translations.title: طراحی بک اند یا سیستم سرویس (پروژه جدید)

projects.description:
Amazing time picker is an Angular 2+ library, which was developed by me and a friend, Yousef as component to pick time. During development for a client, I've realised that Angular does not posses a good time picker, which is also compatible with material design.
This itself became a motivation to start an open-source project in order to cover that need. We worked after hours or on weekends, most of the time in paralell. Project soon became popular, we earned around 150 stars and 3000 downloads weekly, and people started to contribute to the project, and issues came one after each other.
Over time, we added different templating, option to change colors, localisation, and reduced the library size, and it is still online and being downloaded, of course few other forks got popular over past years
projects.technicalDescription:
Writing a library is a difficult task and cumbersome. Make this an open-source project, it would become 10x harder. I did not know about this just until project started to be used. Project initially was written in Angular 2, but after new versions, Angular 4, 5 and so on, we realised that we might have compatibility issues if we upgrade the build tools into latest. So I had to write some level of custom codes for each version to make sure we are compatible even with Angular 2.
Timepicker can be opened with a Angular directive, or programatically. Both are accepted use cases. Before each release, CI/CD installs the time picker on Angular 2, 4, 5 sample projects, and using cypress we test the modules to make sure in all versions it's working just fine.
Project provided also css overrides, to make sure the main application css was not affecting the time picker. The bootstrap and material templates were written in pure css, since we wanted the library to work on every project without forcing unnecessary dependencies.
As a general purpose feature, we needed right-to-left support, so that was added also at some point in the time. The level of details grown over time, to limit some  hours to not be selected, to be only minute picker, and so on.
projects.title: Amazing TimePicker

projects.description:
ArcGis Dashboard tool is a proprietary web application used for understanding, and navigating through GIS based information exported through different sources, such as govermental boundries, water areas, historical locations, and helps users to understand what kind of limitation applies to an specific area of interest.
Large amount of data in different formats, such as geojson, and shapefiles were stored in the database and SPA interface helps clients to pick those necessary, check the versioning and many more.
In this project I was getting help from a UX designer at first, but later I had to built things by myself and also manage the product user journy by taking steer in refinement meetings.
projects.technicalDescription:
Software fully built on top of Next.js using react, scss styling and a glassi theme in the beginning. Soon after few sprints, I've realised that there are two problems:
* Software should run without a server, so I did convert the next.js to craco, and also due to having specific urls with dynamic Unique ids, I could not use the static exporting.
* The final client introduced their own design system, which I had to use those components as much as possible. This thing itself took a long shot, due to webcomponents used in the project, and react wrapper was not that up-to-date.
The usage of react-query library was a huge help indeed, which helped to manage the errors, timeouts  and some layer of caching. In this project I have introduced common archive, single component manager.
Instead of google maps, I had to use the ArcGIS javascript library. ArcGIS has different approach to maps, it's more useful in GIS heavy environments. The map in the center of screen, was mainly used for selecting area of interests, and it had to be done by various methods: Draw a polygon, Draw a rectangle, import shapefile, import geojson. I've worked a bit in depth with drawing tools, layers, cleaning layers, prevent overlapping areas, and spent adequet time learning ArcGIS documentations.
For the uploading geojson file and shapefiles, I provided two methods, first by choosing a file dialog, and second by dragging file in case you are in the map screen. I have implemented a dragzone,  which every component can listen two, and as many as handlers could be there to accept file by desired types.
Authentication used in this project was MSAL integration. Msal with react itself is a bit a challenge, also I understood that deeply in the azure configuration there are undocumented differences between 'Webapp' and 'SPA'. Took me few days of debugging for correct refresh token, signin, signout behavior.
projects.title: ArcGis dashboard tool

projects.description:
This project was a utility app, for configurating a German manufacturer for excavators to track the actual position and orientation of the bet in excavators.
Product was a small device, attachable externally, and had a internal battery, with BLE communication protocol.
I had partnershiped with a mid-level React Native developer in this project, and we built the application from scratch in few months.
In the application you could search for devices, and after creating a connection to specifc device, you could see the details of the device, orientation, uptime, metric values - about 30 parameters at the time.
There was an option to write few paramteres to device, request for OTA, restart and check the remaining battery level as well. Product was delivered to the client with AppStore and Google play draft setup in the end.
projects.technicalDescription:
Project was heavily depending on the BLE protocol, but in the same time was depending on the http apis. Client developed http API, we had to implement the mirroring option into the device, which meant to copy whatever is in the API, into the device for faster reactions instead of waiting for regular update cycle.
In the product I had implemented hooks for BLE, using react-native-ble-plx library, and react-native-bluetooth-state-manager and they could be used interchangably with http or BLE, basically mimiced the same api on both ends.
UI was developed without external library, using pure react native components and Animation from the core library. I had designed a 3D version of the device and shown in the app in specific places, and conneted that to the actual gyroscope state of the device as well which really challenged me. The texture left due to rejection of client to use the 3D in their mvp.
Project was split between me and my colleage, I did mostly the BLE part and he did the UI components, and navigation section. We met the client once a week, and conducted a demo of recent features. BLE api required few times to be changed, so I was few times in contact with electronic team and explained what was needed in order for us to proceed.
One of the interested screens was to implement a camera for scanning QR code. I did that few times before this occasion, but ironacally this time I used a new camera library which sounded more promising to me and I had to learn a bit for that, and found out it does not work in a modal, so I patched the IOS version to make it work. Later on the project, we realised that does not need to be in modal at all and requires it's own screen to be navigated to. In this screen I discovered the react-native-hole-view, a component which helps you to build a hole inside View, and it was really handly to create the designs.
Many regular libraries of react native where used, such as floating aciton buttons, moment, formik, gradient, svg, and vision camera.
projects.title: BLE Hardware configuration with React Native

projects.description:
React go dashboard (commercial demo name) or more precisely "Fireback", is a set of modules, codebase, framework which tends to help developer (originally developed for myself to build faster for clients) build long lasting, extremly performant, reliable software which runs on every platform, such as: Android, IOS, Wide webservers (Ubuntu, Windows, MIPS) Desktop applications, and microcontrollers, such as ESP32 from espressif.
The goal is, to build independent software from SaaS providers, which can run fully offline, can be hosted on premise or cloud, makes possible to collaborate, having full authentication flow, and standard requests, responses, query dsl all out of the box.
After many years of developing, I had realised so many basic features, such as pagination, search, sorting, configurating database, logging, importing, exporting data, and many more, are usually missing in most of products. Poor UI, missing keyboard functionalities, heavy front-ends, or uncompiled source code on server side seemed to me a big problem in order to deliver high quality products. To answer all these I have created fireback, and as a demo, react go dashboard.
When building a project on Fireback, you define most of the work in yaml configurations, and fireback code generator creates many functions required for those entities, create, edit, delete, advance query, searching, accessing them using CLI, GRPC, HTTP, permission system.
From a backend perspective, project can be running monolith, or as microservice. It's very lightweight, as low as 8MB for linux servers on a mid size project, and does not depend on any external library, and does not need a docker to make sure it's running since there will be no requirement as such.
From a front-end side, a full size project weights less than 800KB, and 300KB on first load, on a full size project, including mocks for testing, icons and so. It's so low in weight that I have embedded the UI directly into ESP32 chips which only can contain 4MB of flash memory.
On the mobile side, the same backend, and front-end can bundle into the cordova, and generate APK or IPA for Android and IOS Platforms. Backend can be removed from mobile, in case the app is fully running on cloud, and no extra code is needed. Backend is managed in a way which can save all the data on SQLite as well, without extra configuration other than specifying it's gonna run on a mobile device.
On the desktop side, it provides Linux, Windows, and Mac binaries, with or without backend, as low as 20MB for a full size project with backend. Having similar situation on mobile, it can work in many different setups and scenarios.
Due to minimal usage of the external libraries in front-end, not only the UI is light, but also is fast, and MacOSX theme proves how near such apps can get to the native UI appearance just with CSS, including light and dark mode.
React go dashboard or Fireback, can also produce a lot of C code, such as entities and http routes, and give a lot of boilerplate for products which need to run on microcontrollers or low memory environments.
projects.technicalDescription:
React Go Dashboard (Fireback) is written in Golang, C, JavaScript (React), TypeScript and SCSS, with some scripts.
Project consists of main parts, called `cmd`, `core` and `modules`. In a Fireback project, we do not have such thing as one project, but rather, there are many modules, such as workspaces, roles, users, payment, which could combine inside a `cmd` folder, and generate a new product, for specific ARCH or operating system.
For example, when we are running app A on desktop, we omit workspaces library to some level, and do not  include the payment module in the binary because it just does not make sense when running offline, and on the cloud, they are very well included.
## Backend part (Golang) 
is very well organized, it's based on relational database, mainly SQLite or MySQL, and heavily depends on entity concept. For every entity, Fireback creates:
- CLI options, to create entities, get one, delete, bulk update, export or export to csv, json, yaml - When creating an entity, you can include other entities as child, single, array, object or many2many - Advanced validation on the entity, or on children. - Create sub entities (other modules which are child here), also update them on patch. - HTTP Requests, get, query with pagination, sorting, filters by each column - Mock system for entities, as well as seeder to contain the initial data of the project. For example, if you have a gender entity, you can define them in a yaml file, and system puts them into the database when starting. - GRPC Support for all actions. - Permissions being created and added to the system. All entities work under workspace, role and user, so there are no specific code or config required. Every content is bound to the current workspace. - Advanced translation system for entity, separate for each column on database. Fireback translates queries or getItemById upon sending accept-language in headers via GRPC, HTTP or CLI. - Migration codes in the database. - Proto definition files, both for automatic generated code and developer defined code.
## Thirdparty SDKs, JavaScript, React.js
Fireback modules, all are exported to the JavaScript sdk, and React.js sdk. This feature is one of the pioneer options that helps front-end developers to use backend directly in their source code, instead of writing fetch, or http call codes, managing state, error handling, error messages, they would just call the exported functions, and underlying sdk (auto generated) would handle it for them.
With this feature not only we make coding faster, but also it's more clearer, since all the definition of request and responses are also included. It would remove the necessity of checking documents and intelisense would suggest fields, and possible responses directly into the IDE. Plus, if a feature is not supported by backend anymore, it would be compiler error on front-end to include those functions and it reduces the out of sync issues between backend and front-end to zero.
## File uploads
One of the large issues which has been solved by Golang community and hence Fireback, is file upload. It has embedded the TUS upload framework, which allows reliable uploading, resumable uploads out of the box. In the front-end and as well as SDK, react hooks and JavaScript functions for uploading multiple files are provided. Drive module, handles the file uploads and after storing the uploaded content on the disk, Drive creates a record in File entities table, with all information of the owner, user created, file size and many more. All files are available both on download mode, and inline mode. Some minor work has been done for coverting files in the backend also but it's not major.
## Packaging of the server side
Major target products now run on cloud hosting, and React go dashboard also generates Windows Server, Ubuntu Server, and even Mac Server binaries, and they all come with installers. All binaries both work with MySQL and SQLite, therefor front-end developers can install their own version of the backend, and if the project provides mocks, they would run the mocks and can start developing without the requirement of installing backend tools, such as Docker, heavy Java environments and many more. Initializing and configuration of the product comes with CLI, by calling `fireback init` it would ask the database credentials, the ports http server, and file server will be lifted, and creates `project-configuration.yml` on that directory. This easily allows for multiple environments on any project.
## Front-end: React.js
Fireback also has a UI project, which is a react.js app, could be built either with Next.js or craco based on project need. It follows the backend API Response/Request structure, and contains a lof of ready to use components inside of it. Front-end does not force any libraries to be used, neither does not uses itself, other than react and few utilities. Entire style system is pure css (SCSS preprocessor) and comes with automatic/dark/light MacOSX theme. Theme system could be extended, and does not rely on JavaScript at all.
Product aims to be super light, without components entire build folder weights less than 250KB, and 820KB on a test with full modules and components on a microcontroller chip.
Front-end also follows a multi target architecture, developer can build multiple products out of same source code, again without any external libraries, or monorepo, etc.

All these happens just by defining entities structure in the Module2.yml files
projects.title: React go dashboard (Fireback core)

projects.description:
Software aims to give a management system for house associations, specially those neighbourhoods which owned by a company or, a house owner that has multiple houses or manages the rental for the owners. As a team leader in this project, I had to build the major components of the app, lists, filters etc, api calls, forms, form validations and etc. Based on my role, I had direct contact with the client, and daily meeting with business analysts with developers to ensure everything was on the track, and I would report to delivery manager as well.
All of the fearures inside the app, are categorized by 3 sections (roles) inside the system:
- Homeowners - Managers - Vendors.
## Homeowners
Home owners are people who basically own a house, might add several houses, giving the exact house location, area.
## Manager
Managers are people who are having a vote in the association board, they can accept requests such as repair, violations or committee voting
## Vendors
Vendors are the most limited people in the system, they only complete work order requests

## Main features of the app
### Accounting
Solution contains a small accounting system, with the option to download the invoices, see the transactions, approve payments, etc It gives the software an option to set the payment method to stripe or wire transfer, by giving each payment method information Homeowners and vendors also can specifiy their bank account information, for management to use them for payments.
### Document Center
All documents across the system are accessible via Document Center, where users can delete, browse, check history of all the documents and files which has been shared between them. They could be downloaded, and PDF/Images could be seen inside app in a modal for ease of access.
### Work Order
This feature is a major one and important across the all roles, homeowners or managers can request a work order to be done. Work orders can be different types, such as repair, cutting grass, replace wires, and many more. Each request could be approved by a committee of managers, and then assigned to an specific vendor.
### Violation Report
Homeowners are able to report a violation to the association, such as wrong parking, damaging visual appreance of the block, or other kind of disrupting behavior.
## Authentication system
The authentication was done using email or phone number, after you login in to your account, system checks how many roles are assigned to you, and if there is more than one, you can select that role. After selecting, you would be moved to your default screen. App does not provide a dashboard, but rather different archive component depending on the user role type.
Beyond react-native app, there is a react.js app on the web version, mostly focused on the manager part, which had all of the features in the app before hand. I had to look at the API most of the time on the web version and replicate the functions on react native side.
projects.technicalDescription:
Project was written in React Native, and there was extensive usage of the redux. Before I take over the leadership, project was  going for 3 months and barely 2 screens were ready.
As the first step, I begin to polish existing screens, and simplified the development flow. It took me long time and few weeks of over hour work to put some practises inside, including:
- More standard API calls, moving http calls into hooks - Fix the visual apperance of the software, margin, padding, which seems easy but in fact damaged the product vastly. - Implement error handling for submiting forms, single pages, lists - Create a general archive (flast list) screen, which was used by 80% of all lists inside the app. - Create an advanced filtering component which worked correctly with lists, could be modified per requirement of specific business scenario, opened a modal, as well as showing the selected condition under the page title. - Reliable page title, and page actions. In fact it seems to be a simple thing, but it took a notable time to replace all screens page title with their main actions with a general component to prevent disorientation and flickering when screens were changed.
projects.title: Self-Management Solutions for Homeowner’s Association Mobile Application

projects.description: - In SEEK various programming projects challenge their employees. As a full- stack developer, daily tasks include upgrading and tuning existing code bases and refactor codes; also updating dependencies and monitoring deployment processes. Using industry standard  AWS services, such as EC2, Elasticache, RDS, etc. are exciting parts of the role. - One of the most challenging matters of SEEK and their subsidiaries is deploying the same codebase  through multiple targets, countries and cultures. This helps examine real world application of programming skills. This is where real TDD comes into play. Facing AI solutions for managing  large-scale traffic of applications and working with data scientists is a glorious opportunity. - The biggest legacy of SEEK goes beyond the technical; it delves into the multicultural working environment. Working with skilled co-workers from all backgrounds teaches valuable lessons beyond technical borders; our work extends to how to be a true team player, involvement in all  aspects of a project and earning your team's trust from inception of an idea to the delivered product.
projects.title: Job Portal Career Path

projects.description: Compete for glory in automated sports experiences, tournaments, brackets, network with others, host tournaments, create and join teams, squad up in your favorite games. Find events, leagues, tournaments, brackets. App is using extensive graphical animations and elements using css, canvas and lottie. As a user, you could signup and join/host tournaments in different game, the most favorable was pubg. I spent a lot of long hours with co-founder to validate designs, implement the user journeys App used ngrx store, an main logic of the app was unit tested but overall was depending on manual testing. The backend written in node.js, MySQL, Express framework. Linking games, moving back and forth from the app, and implementing webhooks in games to handle the changes in the scores, finishing rounds of games, all were really unique to this specific project. Many effects were unavailable in css, such as moving countdown in specific format, which caused me to write a lot of pure canvas code in order to achieve the desired game effect. This one also was one of the unique projects, which I have integrated sound effects, and be involved a lot with the AppStore/GPlay compliance section due to nature of the product.
projects.title: Mobile Game Leaderboard Ionic Application

projects.description: MiniFirma, is a discontinued mobile application which main purpose was to facilitate creating invoices and taking legal papers and store them in one place. Technology: React Native Platforms: IOS, Android Status: MVP only, discontinued due to lack of enough development funds - Build the entire app from scratch, - Use custom designed charts in the app - Use SQLlite inside the app, to store the information - Use camera module, to take pictures of invoices - Manage the business information, to create digital business card
projects.title: Minifirma Accounting app

projects.description: As the main React.js developer in one of network management softwares, which was used to monitor the latency of internet network between nodes, mainly used in Japan, I have followed responsibilities such as: - Interactive maps using D3 maps, allowing users to zoom in and out, pan, and interact with various elements on the map to see the network speed on the map. - Design real time heatmap of data flow across the United States, and Japan. - Implement google time series API in the front-end, to query the internet speed over time on different nodes - Create complex forms, using formik, in order to save the configuration, background listeners, and files - Conduct code reviews to ensure quality and maintainability of the React.js codebase. - Work with the QA team to ensure that React.js applications are properly tested, most of the tests written in cypress testing framework - Implement most of the actions in React-Redux, plus rxjs for realtime changes and apply the results into the stores
projects.title: Senior React.js Developer for Network Management App

projects.description: My main role was to develop the core of multi-purpose template, to complete more projects by fewer man-power and shorter time. By reusing code and concepts for each project. Our theme, "_tkpersian" was inspired by open source "underscore" project, with lots of localized components and sugar code for developing with long-term support perspective. Netware has been invested on "Smart home" solutions, comparable to IoT (Internet of things) concept. After I joined, we were focus on both hardware and software design, to access devices over local network and Internet. My role was to create the software full-stack solutions, like creating dashboard administrator, user privileges, managing devices, etc. It's worthwhile to mention I got lot's of experience with working on embedded devices, and writing/fabricating their drives to connect with computer.
projects.title: Ovio IOT Platform

projects.description:
PordoWeb CMS, was a proprietary content management system, started in PHP and Codeingniter initially, with the purpose of serving content based websites and e-commerce stores.
When I joined the company, it was early stage of cms development. There was a basic post mechanism, to write articles and a category selection screen.
The first thing I started to do was writing a templating system, meaning you could build several different projects inside the same cms project, similar to wordpress themes.
Along building the themes, I brought the plugins mechanism, and each project (template or theme) could define what kind of these plugins requires, such as slider, mega menu, and many custom forms which built depending on the need of project.
Most of my career in this company I was building backend side, and UI related to management part. Since the progress in the projects become much quicker, management hired few more people build the client projects using this CMS, therefor the amount of work I had to deliver was soared to the sky.
After first year, we also added A CRM module and a shop system on top of the CMS, which made it even more complex than ever. Before I join the company, I had written a simple ORM in PHP, but it was not capable of the level of such complex code base, and it was used almost everywhere in the product.
We delivered around 30 websites in those years, and finally we shot down the business due to lack of profitability.
projects.technicalDescription:
Project was founded on top of PHP 5 and, MySQL. I had written almost entire backend, except the customer club section.
Project did not use a solid ORM, in fact I've added my own ORM into the project, so called "MVP ORM", which is still available in codeproject. ORM was not sophisticated at all, did not provide migration either. But managed to work for our projects at the time.
I believe the only reason any project can use template or plugin system is due to PHP architecture, and that's what I have used.
Except one commerical store, all projects were hosted on shared hosting services and mostly managed by us. Code did not have complex arch but yet was difficult to hire people for it, since there was too much to learn.
By the end of company, we all realised using WordPress for such projects could give a much faster and better experience for us and clients.
projects.title: PordoWeb CMS project series

translations.description:
پردو سی ام اس محصول انحصاری و اختصاصی طراحی شده توسط پردو وب بود که با هدف ابزاری برای ساختن سریع پروژه های وب سایتی با امکانات متنوع نوشته شده بود.
زمانی که من به پردو پیوستم شرایط نرم افزاری پروژه در ابتدای مسیر بود. هدف شرکت طراحی و توسعه وب سایت های تعدادی از مشتریان بود و برای این کار در حال ساختن سیستم مدیریت محتوا بودند. نرم افزار داری امکان پست گذاری و دسته بندی مطالب بود و تنها یک پروژه روی آن اجرا شده بود.
اولین اقدام من در این پروژه، طراحی سیستم قالب گیری بود که روشی برای اجرا چندین پروژه همزمان  با استفاده از همان نسخه سی ام اس بود. در واقع میتوان گفت این سرویس بسیار مشابه با سیستم wp-template ورد پرس طراحی شد.
در کنار سیستم قالب، شروع به ساختن سیستم پلاگین کردم که هر قالب بر حسب نیاز میتوانست با یک فایل config.php لیست پلاگین های مورد نظر را اعلام کند. پلاگین ها  همگی با خود نرم افزار نصب میشدند فقط فعال سازی آن ها منوط به استفاده از این تنظیمات بود. اولین پلاگین هایی که طراحی کردم شامل مگامنو، فرم ساز و اسلایدر بود البته در ادامه پروژه حدود ۲۰ پلاگین مختلف طراحی شد اما میتوان گفت پیچیده ترین پلاگین ها گردش کار و فرم ساز بودند.
من بیشتر وقت در این پروژه و شرکت را در طراحی و معماری بک اند گذاشتم. البته  این پروژه به صورت MVC پایه گذاری شده بود و به همین دلیل طراحی ظاهر گرافیکی یا همان فرانت اند پروژه نیز در قسمت بک اند (پنل مدیریتی) با من بود و بقیه همکاران ظاهر سایت ها و در واقع قالب های آن پروژه ها را طراحی میکردند.
پس از سال اول، یکی از مشتریان درخواست سیستم گردش کار یا همان CRM را کرد که میتوان گفت مسیر اقتصادی پروژه از سمت طراحی سایت به سمت فروشگاه ساز و سی ار ام تغییر کرد. با اینکه افراد جدیدی در پروژه اضافه شده بودند اما از آنجایی که طراحی ماژول های  اساسی بر عهده من بود حجم کاری من به شدت افزایش پیدا کرد.
در کل مدت فعالیت من در این پروژه، حدود ۳۰ وب سایت مختلف طراحی شدند و به دست مشتریان داده شد.
translations.technicalDescription:
پروژه بر اساس پی اچ پی ۵ و دیتابیس MySQL بنا شده بود. من تقریبا بیشترین بخش از بک اند پروژه را به غیر از باشگاه مشتریان نوشته بودم.
پروژه دارای ORM قوی نبود، در حقیقت خود سیستم ORM رو شخصا طراحی کرده بودم که هنوز هم در سایت CodeProject قابل دسترسی است. با اینکه قابلیت های اساسی مانند migration را کم داشت اما در تمام مدت توسط من و بقیه اعضای تیم شرکت در همه پروژه ها مورد استفاده قرار گرفت.
یکی از مهمترین چیز هایی که من در این پروژه آموختم این بود که زبان PHP  بهترین گزینه برای طراحی سیستم هایی است که نیازمند پلاگین نویسی و قالب نویسی هستند شاید به همین دلیل پروژه های بزرگ و موفقی مانند وردپرس و مجنتو و ویکی با استفاده از  php نوشته شدند.
به غیر از یک پروژه فروشگاهی که تیم اختصاصی خود مشتری آن را مدیریت میکرد، همه پروژه های بر روی هاست های مشترک قرار داده میشدند.
در انتهای شرکت، همه ما به این نتیجه رسیدیم که استفاده از وردپرس برای  همه فعالیت های شرکت و نوشتن پلاگین برای آن کار منطقی تری است و بنابراین از ادامه پروژه با استفاده از این سی ام اس اختصاصی منصرف شدیم.
translations.title: گروه پروژه های پردو سی ام اس

projects.description: As a senior React Native developer, I participated into the building solar panel commissioning and usage monitoring app, for household purposes - Build the navigation system and project structure - Bind the UI to backend, and visualize the the information about charge controller incoming/outgoing electricity charge - Build Interactive charts using D3 and react-native-svg, using the calculation from the d3 library and bind it to the svg module to make it usable in the phone environment - Build user onboarding flow, complex wizards, to add user panels, definite their charge controller (MPPT) and battery bank - Build different targets, and make the app whitelabel for IOS and Android - Write the hardware data interchange in goalng - Develop sync mechanism, to keep the device configuration both on the hardware and system backend written in golang - Implement the monitoring system, error reporting third party libraries, and adding push notifications from charging device
projects.title: Solar System Charge controller

translations.title: نرم افزار شارژ کنترلر پنل خورشیدی

projects.description: Teamtelefon is a product to help people for to organize and distribute the medical calls, and ensure that there is always someone to take the call. As a senior React Native Engineer, I worked on the product: - Create the list of available people - Build entire mechanism of creating user availability, write complex calculation algorithms to split user availability, prevent time collision - Create a full user phonebook system, and synchronize it with phone native contacts list - Make the notifications coming using fireback, event and trigger system to notify people before their shifts - User settings panel - Write the backend in the firebase toolset, serverless mechanism - Used real-time database for storing the information
projects.title: Telefony team management React Native app

services.description:
Almost every software product runs on a backend system, which provides HTTP server, GRPC, and database management. Depending on the strategy, more or less logic can be stored in the backend.
I develop backend products in Golang or C, based on Fireback project. The benefit of my work is extreme fast time to market - for small apps less than 10 days, and many common features included, such as user management, permissions, abac, socket connection, http routes, complete reporting, crud operation and more.
Products you build with me can work independently, depending on your requirement I can provide interface (Web app/Desktop/Mobile app) for it, or on premise team can implement that part.
Products you get would work many times faster than other competetors, due to technologies used while developing it. Unlike other solutions, backends using Fireback do not need re-write after mvp version. The code I build now, works for few decades without maintenance.
services.name: Backend, System Service, and CLI Applications

translations.description:
تقریبا تمامی محصولات نرم افزاری نیازمند سرویس بک اند هستند. بک اند وظیفه فراهم کردن سرویس های اینترنتی (HTTP)، همچنین ارایه ابزار های ترمینال و ارتباط با دیتابیس را دارد.
بسته به نوع طراحی بیشترین منطق تجاری نرم افزار و عملکرد یک مجموعه در قسمت بک اند نوشته میشود.
پروژه های بک اندی که من طراحی میکنم بیشتر با زبان Golang و بخش هایی که نیاز به سرعت فوق العاده داشته باشند و یا نیازمند اجرا بر روی میکروکنترلر باشند با C نوشته میشوند.
تمامی پروژه ها دارای امکانات اساسی مانند پشتیبان گیری، گزارش گیری، مدیریت کاربران، سطح دسترسی ها و سرویس سوکت دسترسی ترمینال و همچنین خروجی برای زبان جاوااسکریپت به همراه پشتیبانی مستقیم انگولار و ریکت هستند.
بر اساس نیاز شما، امکان طراحی فرانت اند یا نسخه های گرافیکی تحت وب، ویندوزی، و حتی موبایل نیز وجود دارد. همچنین داکیومنت های کاملی برای استفاده از پروژه به شما داده میشود تا تیم داخلی بتواند نرم افزار های مختلفی را بر اساس این بک اند تولید کند.
translations.name: طراحی بک اند، سیستم سرویس و نرم افزار های ترمینالی (CLI)

services.description:
I deliver reliable desktop application for my clients using either Go wails or Electron.js framework. These two products are hybrid frameworks which allow an HTML/CSS app (existing or new one) to be converted into the Mac/Win/Linux application.
When I build a front-end application, the default project comes with mac theme unless it's specified in the contract. Any custom behavior in desktop application is easily possible with much lesser amount of time.
This type of service is recommended for established businesses which want to increase their audience and make their users life easier with quicker and faster access to the software products.
Background operations are also provided to some applications, such as video formatting, audio processing, rendering. All these functionalities will be added using  native elements, aka, FFMPEG for performance reasons.
I recommend clients to use Go Wails framework due to it's low memory usage over electron, but the electron project is also available.
services.name: Desktop Application with Electron or Wails

translations.description:
در این نوع قرار نرم افزار دسکتاپی قابل نصب بر روی ویندوز لینوکس و یا مک برای مشتریان ارایه میشود. این سرویس میتواند بر روی پروژه های از قبل موجود وب (ریکت یا انگولار) ارایه شود.
در صورتی که نرم افزار جدید بوده و یا از ابتدا نوشته شود، این سرویس ابتدا نیازمند عقد قرارداد طراحی نرم افزار تحت وب بوده چون بیشتر امکانات دسکتاپ در همان قرارداد به صورت رایگان ارایه میشود.
طراحی اپ دسکتاپی برای بیزنس هایی که دارای مشتری های ثابت هستند، مانند نرم افزار های مالی بسیار مفید است چرا که سرعت عملکرد کاربران را شدیدا افزایش داده و هرکسی توانایی استفاده از نرم افزار به صورت آفلاین را دارد.
در پروژه هایی که بک اند آن توسط من طراحی شوند، نسخه افلاین نرم افزار به طور کامل میتواند در حالت دسکتاپ نیز ارایه شود. در هر قرارداد، قالب مک به طور رایگان ارایه میشود در صورتی که قالب ویندوز و یا لینوکس مورد نیاز باشد به سادگی به مجموعه اضافه خواهد شد.
در نرم افزار هایی که نیاز به محاحسبات پیچیده و یا پردازش تصویر دارند از لایبرری های  اصلی مانند FFMPEG در لایه های زیرین استفاده میشوند. و کد های مربوط به هر سیستم عامل به زبان های C و یا Golang نوشته میشوند.
پیشنهاد شخصی بنده برای مشتریان استفاده از Go Wails برای طراحی نرم افزار دسکتاپی به دلیل مصرف بسیار پایین سی پی یو و حافظه بوده اما نسخه الکترون پروژه نیز در صورت تمایل ارایه میشود.
translations.name: نرم افزار های  دسکتاپی با الکترون یا Go Wails

services.description:
Designing and developing a modern yet reliable front-end application such as management dashboards, SaaS software, mobile we app are in high demand in current market.
I help clients to build their front-end project based on React.js, with a light code base and organized structure that can last for decade. The products which I build do not require re-write after MVP, companies can maintain the project after initial phase with me or by their own team.
Front-end Applications I'd create are able to run as Web application, Mobile application (Hybrid, not recommened) Desktop apps for Windows, Linux, and Mac. All softwares, do come with full user management system, backup, datatables, mobile card view, filtering, and many more features which are essential for any modern product.
services.name: Front-end Design and Architecture with React.js

translations.description:
طراحی و ساخت نرم افزار تحت وب مدرن و قابل اعتماد مانند داشبورد های مدیریتی، سرویس های نرم افزاری و اپلیکیشن های موبایل هیبریدی از جمله نیاز های پر تقاضای بیزنس های امروزی هستند.
من به مشتریان کمک میکنم تا پروژه های تحت وب رو با استفاده از ریکت و معماری عمیق با  ساختار کدی بسیار ساده اما حرفه ای بنا کنند. پروژه های نرم افزاری من به در کمتر از ۱۰ روز کاری قابل اجرا خواهند بود چرا که بیش از چندین سال بر روی معماری آن فکر و کد نویسی شده است.
امکانات و بخش های مورد نیاز هر پروژه معمولا به سرعت زیادی اجرا میشوند و هنگام قرارداد شما میتوانید از ماژول های پیش تعریف شده مانند پردخت آنلاین، کیف پول، استفاده کنید.
تمامی پروژه های فرانت که با ریکت طراحی میشوند، دارای نسخه ویندوزی، مک، لینوکس و اندروید و آیفون خواهند بود. سیستم مدیریت کاربران و سطح دسترسی هر کاربر، دعوت نامه ها برای تمامی پروژه ها  ارایه میشود.
translations.name: طراحی نرم افزار تحت وب با ریکت

items.title: Web, Mobile, Desktop and Backend Developer | Ali Torabi Services and Resume

translations.headline1: طراح نرم افزار و برنامه نویس
translations.headline2: من نرم افزار های کامل در قسمت بک اند، فرانت اند، موبایل، دسکتاپ یا میکرو کنترلر طراحی میکنم.
translations.title: سوابق علی ترابی |‌ طراحی بک اند وب دسکتاپ داشبورد هوشمند سازی
